def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    norm_objectives = (objectives - objectives.min(axis=0)) / (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = norm_objectives[:, 0] * 0.7 + norm_objectives[:, 1] * 0.3
    base_solution = archive[np.argmin(combined_scores)][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if b - a > 1:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    if np.random.rand() < 0.7:
        node = np.random.choice(new_solution)
        old_pos = np.where(new_solution == node)[0][0]
        new_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        if new_pos != old_pos:
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:old_pos], new_solution[old_pos+1:]])
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:new_pos], [node], new_solution[new_pos:]])
            if np.random.rand() < 0.5 and new_pos > 0 and new_pos < N-1:
                new_solution[new_pos-1], new_solution[new_pos] = new_solution[new_pos], new_solution[new_pos-1]

    return new_solution

algorithm: {The new algorithm selects a solution from the archive based on a dynamic objective score that balances both objectives, then applies a novel local search combining adaptive segment reversal with objective-aware node swapping and conditional path inversion to generate a neighbor solution while ensuring feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    max_obj1 = max(x[1][0] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    max_obj2 = max(x[1][1] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (x[1][0]/max_obj1 + x[1][1]/max_obj2))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment reversal with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        reversed_segment = segment[::-1]

        # Evaluate reversal based on both objectives
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])
        reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])

        if reversed_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = reversed_segment

    # Objective-aware node swapping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        if i != j:
            # Calculate cost difference for both objectives
            cost_diff = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if cost_diff < 0:
                new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    # Conditional path inversion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        k = np.random.randint(2, N//2)
        path = new_solution[:k]
        inverted_path = path[::-1]

        # Evaluate inversion
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[path[-1], new_solution[k]])
        inverted_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]])

        if inverted_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[:k] = inverted_path

    return new_solution

algorithm: {The new algorithm selects a solution from the archive based on a diversity-aware selection criterion, then applies a hybrid local search combining segment rotation, node exchange, and edge flipping with adaptive probability checks to ensure feasibility and explore the solution space more effectively.}

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    diversity_scores = np.std(objectives, axis=0)
    weights = diversity_scores / (np.sum(diversity_scores) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = objectives[:, 0] * weights[0] + objectives[:, 1] * weights[1]
    base_solution = archive[np.argmin(combined_scores)][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Segment rotation with adaptive probability
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        k = np.random.randint(1, N//2)
        new_solution = np.roll(new_solution, k)

    # Node exchange with edge flipping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            new_solution[i:j] = new_solution[i:j][::-1]
        if np.random.rand() < 0.4 and i > 0 and j < N-1:
            new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    weights = [0.6, 0.4]  # Weight for first objective is higher
    selected = min(archive, key=lambda x: weights[0]*x[1][0] + weights[1]*x[1][1])[0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search: node insertion + segment rotation
    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to rotate
    a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
    segment_size = b - a + 1

    # Rotate segment left or right
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], 1)
    else:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], -1)

    # Apply node insertion if beneficial
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:  # 40% chance to insert
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]

        # Find best insertion position
        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = cost1 + cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    weights = np.random.uniform(0.3, 0.7)
    scores = [weights * obj[0] + (1 - weights) * obj[1] for _, obj in archive]
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    selected = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Hybrid local search with adaptive probabilities
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:  # Higher probability for relocation
        # Node relocation
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]

        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = weights * cost1 + (1 - weights) * cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)
    else:
        # Segment reversal
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (0.7 * x[1][0] + 0.3 * x[1][1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment rotation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        k = np.random.randint(1, len(segment))
        rotated_segment = np.concatenate([segment[k:], segment[:k]])
        new_solution[a:b+1] = rotated_segment

    # Node transposition with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if i != j and (i != 0 or j != N-1):
            # Evaluate potential transposition
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            swapped_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if swapped_cost < original_cost:
                temp = new_solution[i]
                new_solution[i] = new_solution[j]
                new_solution[j] = temp

    # Conditional edge reversal
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
            reversed_segment = segment[::-1]
            # Evaluate reversal
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if reversed_cost < original_cost:
                new_solution[i:j+1] = reversed_segment

    return new_solution

algorithm: {The new algorithm selects a solution from the archive based on a weighted sum of normalized objectives with adaptive weights, then applies a hybrid local search combining 3-opt and segment reversal with dynamic probabilities to generate a neighbor solution while ensuring feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    obj1 = np.array([obj[0] for _, obj in archive])
    obj2 = np.array([obj[1] for _, obj in archive])
    min1, max1 = np.min(obj1), np.max(obj1)
    min2, max2 = np.min(obj2), np.max(obj2)
    if max1 != min1:
        norm_obj1 = (obj1 - min1) / (max1 - min1)
    else:
        norm_obj1 = np.ones_like(obj1)
    if max2 != min2:
        norm_obj2 = (obj2 - min2) / (max2 - min2)
    else:
        norm_obj2 = np.ones_like(obj2)

    # Adaptive weights based on objective ranges
    range1 = max1 - min1
    range2 = max2 - min2
    total_range = range1 + range2
    if total_range > 0:
        weight1 = range1 / total_range
        weight2 = range2 / total_range
    else:
        weight1 = 0.5
        weight2 = 0.5

    scores = weight1 * norm_obj1 + weight2 * norm_obj2
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    selected = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Dynamic local search operator selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4 + 0.3 * weight1:  # Higher probability for 3-opt when first objective is more important
        # 3-opt
        a, b, c = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=3, replace=False))
        if a == b or b == c or a == c:
            return new_solution

        # Check if 3-opt creates valid tour
        if (new_solution[(a-1)%N] == new_solution[b] or new_solution[(a-1)%N] == new_solution[c] or
            new_solution[a] == new_solution[(b-1)%N] or new_solution[a] == new_solution[(c-1)%N] or
            new_solution[b] == new_solution[(c-1)%N] or new_solution[b] == new_solution[a]):
            return new_solution

        # Perform 3-opt
        segment1 = new_solution[a:b+1]
        segment2 = new_solution[b+1:c+1]
        new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:a], segment2, segment1, new_solution[c+1:]])
    else:
        # Segment reversal
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:a], segment[::-1], new_solution[b+1:]])

    return new_solution

        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:a], segment[::-1], new_solution[b+1:]])

    return new_solution

function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    max_obj1 = max(x[1][0] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    max_obj2 = max(x[1][1] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (x[1][0]/max_obj1 + x[1][1]/max_obj2))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment reversal with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        reversed_segment = segment[::-1]

        # Evaluate reversal based on both objectives
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])
        reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])

        if reversed_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = reversed_segment

    # Objective-aware node swapping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        if i != j:
            # Calculate cost difference for both objectives
            cost_diff = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if cost_diff < 0:
                new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    # Conditional path inversion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        k = np.random.randint(2, N//2)
        path = new_solution[:k]
        inverted_path = path[::-1]

        # Evaluate inversion
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[path[-1], new_solution[k]])
        inverted_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]])

        if inverted_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[:k] = inverted_path

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    norm_objectives = (objectives - objectives.min(axis=0)) / (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = norm_objectives[:, 0] * 0.6 + norm_objectives[:, 1] * 0.4
    base_solution = archive[np.argmin(combined_scores)][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Segment reversal with probabilistic check
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if b - a > 1:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    # Node relocation with edge inversion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        node = np.random.choice(new_solution)
        old_pos = np.where(new_solution == node)[0][0]
        new_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        if new_pos != old_pos:
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:old_pos], new_solution[old_pos+1:]])
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:new_pos], [node], new_solution[new_pos:]])
            if np.random.rand() < 0.3 and new_pos > 0 and new_pos < N-1:
                new_solution[new_pos-1], new_solution[new_pos] = new_solution[new_pos], new_solution[new_pos-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    diversity_scores = np.std(objectives, axis=0)
    weights = diversity_scores / (np.sum(diversity_scores) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = objectives[:, 0] * weights[0] + objectives[:, 1] * weights[1]
    base_solution = archive[np.argmin(combined_scores)][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Segment rotation with adaptive probability
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        k = np.random.randint(1, N//2)
        new_solution = np.roll(new_solution, k)

    # Node exchange with edge flipping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            new_solution[i:j] = new_solution[i:j][::-1]
        if np.random.rand() < 0.4 and i > 0 and j < N-1:
            new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    weights = [0.6, 0.4]  # Weight for first objective is higher
    selected = min(archive, key=lambda x: weights[0]*x[1][0] + weights[1]*x[1][1])[0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search: node insertion + segment rotation
    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to rotate
    a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
    segment_size = b - a + 1

    # Rotate segment left or right
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], 1)
    else:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], -1)

    # Apply node insertion if beneficial
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:  # 40% chance to insert
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]

        # Find best insertion position
        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = cost1 + cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)

    return new_solution

    weights = np.random.uniform(0.3, 0.7)
    scores = [weights * obj[0] + (1 - weights) * obj[1] for _, obj in archive]
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    selected = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Hybrid local search with adaptive probabilities
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:  # Higher probability for relocation
        # Node relocation
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)

        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = weights * cost1 + (1 - weights) * cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)
    else:
        # Segment reversal
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (0.7 * x[1][0] + 0.3 * x[1][1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment rotation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        k = np.random.randint(1, len(segment))
        rotated_segment = np.concatenate([segment[k:], segment[:k]])
        new_solution[a:b+1] = rotated_segment

    # Node transposition with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if i != j and (i != 0 or j != N-1):
            # Evaluate potential transposition
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            swapped_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if swapped_cost < original_cost:
                temp = new_solution[i]
                new_solution[i] = new_solution[j]
                new_solution[j] = temp

    # Conditional edge reversal
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
            reversed_segment = segment[::-1]
            # Evaluate reversal
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if reversed_cost < original_cost:
                new_solution[i:j+1] = reversed_segment

    return new_solution

    """
    Select a promising solution from the archive and generate a neighbor solution from it.

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.
             Each objective is a tuple of two float values (cost in each space).
    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).
    """
    objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    norm_objectives = (objectives - objectives.min(axis=0)) / (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = 1 / (1 + norm_objectives[:, 0] * 0.7 + norm_objectives[:, 1] * 0.3)
    base_solution = archive[np.argmax(combined_scores)][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if b - a > 1:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        node = np.random.choice(new_solution)
        old_pos = np.where(new_solution == node)[0][0]
        new_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        if new_pos != old_pos:
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:old_pos], new_solution[old_pos+1:]])
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:new_pos], [node], new_solution[new_pos:]])
            if np.random.rand() < 0.4 and new_pos > 0 and new_pos < N-1:
                new_solution[new_pos-1], new_solution[new_pos] = new_solution[new_pos], new_solution[new_pos-1]

    return new_solution

    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (0.7 * x[1][0] + 0.3 * x[1][1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment rotation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        k = np.random.randint(1, len(segment))
        rotated_segment = np.concatenate([segment[k:], segment[:k]])
        new_solution[a:b+1] = rotated_segment

    # Node transposition with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if i != j and (i != 0 or j != N-1):
            # Evaluate potential transposition

                            distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            swapped_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if swapped_cost < original_cost:
                temp = new_solution[i]
                new_solution[i] = new_solution[j]
                new_solution[j] = temp

    # Conditional edge reversal
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
            reversed_segment = segment[::-1]
            # Evaluate reversal
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if reversed_cost < original_cost:
                new_solution[i:j+1] = reversed_segment

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    norm_objectives = (objectives - objectives.min(axis=0)) / (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = norm_objectives[:, 0] * 0.3 + norm_objectives[:, 1] * 0.7
    base_solution = archive[np.argmin(combined_scores)][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if b - a > 1:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        node = np.random.choice(new_solution)
        old_pos = np.where(new_solution == node)[0][0]
        new_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        if new_pos != old_pos:
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:old_pos], new_solution[old_pos+1:]])
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:new_pos], [node], new_solution[new_pos:]])
            if np.random.rand() < 0.4 and new_pos > 0 and new_pos < N-1:
                new_solution[new_pos-1], new_solution[new_pos] = new_solution[new_pos], new_solution[new_pos-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    max_obj1 = max(x[1][0] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    max_obj2 = max(x[1][1] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (x[1][0]/max_obj1 + x[1][1]/max_obj2))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment reversal with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        reversed_segment = segment[::-1]

        # Evaluate reversal based on both objectives
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])
        reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])

        if reversed_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = reversed_segment

    # Objective-aware node swapping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        if i != j:
            # Calculate cost difference for both objectives
            cost_diff = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if cost_diff < 0:
                new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    # Conditional path inversion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        k = np.random.randint(2, N//2)
        path = new_solution[:k]
        inverted_path = path[::-1]

        # Evaluate inversion
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[path[-1], new_solution[k]])
        inverted_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]])

        if inverted_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[:k] = inverted_path

    return new_solution

algorithm: {The new algorithm selects a solution from the archive based on a weighted sum of normalized objectives with adaptive weights, then applies a hybrid local search combining 3-opt and segment reversal with dynamic probabilities to generate a neighbor solution while ensuring feasibility.}

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    obj1 = np.array([obj[0] for _, obj in archive])
    obj2 = np.array([obj[1] for _, obj in archive])
    min1, max1 = np.min(obj1), np.max(obj1)
    min2, max2 = np.min(obj2), np.max(obj2)
    if max1 != min1:
        norm_obj1 = (obj1 - min1) / (max1 - min1)
    else:
        norm_obj1 = np.ones_like(obj1)
    if max2 != min2:
        norm_obj2 = (obj2 - min2) / (max2 - min2)
    else:
        norm_obj2 = np.ones_like(obj2)

    # Adaptive weights based on objective ranges
    range1 = max1 - min1
    range2 = max2 - min2
    total_range = range1 + range2
    if total_range > 0:
        weight1 = range1 / total_range
        weight2 = range2 / total_range
    else:
        weight1 = 0.5
        weight2 = 0.5

    scores = weight1 * norm_obj1 + weight2 * norm_obj2
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    selected = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Dynamic local search operator selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4 + 0.3 * weight1:  # Higher probability for 3-opt when first objective is more important
        # 3-opt
        a, b, c = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=3, replace=False))
        if a == b or b == c or a == c:
            return new_solution

        # Check if 3-opt creates valid tour
        if (new_solution[(a-1)%N] == new_solution[b] or new_solution[(a-1)%N] == new_solution[c] or
            new_solution[a] == new_solution[(b-1)%N] or new_solution[a] == new_solution[(c-1)%N] or
            new_solution[b] == new_solution[(c-1)%N] or new_solution[b] == new_solution[a]):
            return new_solution

        # Perform 3-opt
        segment1 = new_solution[a:b+1]
        segment2 = new_solution[b+1:c+1]
        new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:a], segment2, segment1, new_solution[c+1:]])
    else:
        # Segment reversal
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:a], segment[::-1], new_solution[b+1:]])

    return new_solution

                new_solution[i:j+1] = reversed_segment

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    max_obj1 = max(x[1][0] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    max_obj2 = max(x[1][1] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (x[1][0]/max_obj1 + x[1][1]/max_obj2))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment reversal with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        reversed_segment = segment[::-1]

        # Evaluate reversal based on both objectives
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])
        reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])

        if reversed_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = reversed_segment

    # Objective-aware node swapping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        if i != j:
            # Calculate cost difference for both objectives
            cost_diff = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if cost_diff < 0:
                new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    # Conditional path inversion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        k = np.random.randint(2, N//2)
        path = new_solution[:k]
        inverted_path = path[::-1]

        # Evaluate inversion
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[path[-1], new_solution[k]])
        inverted_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]])

        if inverted_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[:k] = inverted_path

    return new_solution

algorithm: {The new algorithm selects a solution from the archive based on a weighted sum of normalized objectives with adaptive weights, then applies a hybrid local search combining 3-opt and segment reversal with dynamic probabilities to generate a neighbor solution while ensuring feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    obj1 = np.array([obj[0] for _, obj in archive])
    obj2 = np.array([obj[1] for _, obj in archive])
    min1, max1 = np.min(obj1), np.max(obj1)
    min2, max2 = np.min(obj2), np.max(obj2)
    if max1 != min1:
        norm_obj1 = (obj1 - min1) / (max1 - min1)
    else:
        norm_obj1 = np.ones_like(obj1)
    if max2 != min2:
        norm_obj2 = (obj2 - min2) / (max2 - min2)
    else:
        norm_obj2 = np.ones_like(obj2)

    # Adaptive weights based on objective ranges
    range1 = max1 - min1
    range2 = max2 - min2
    total_range = range1 + range2
    if total_range > 0:
        weight1 = range1 / total_range
        weight2 = range2 / total_range
    else:
        weight1 = 0.5
        weight2 = 0.5

    scores = weight1 * norm_obj1 + weight2 * norm_obj2
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    selected = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Dynamic local search operator selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4 + 0.3 * weight1:  # Higher probability for 3-opt when first objective is more important
        # 3-opt
        a, b, c = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=3, replace=False))
        if a == b or b == c or a == c:
            return new_solution

        # Check if 3-opt creates valid tour
        if (new_solution[(a-1)%N] == new_solution[b] or new_solution[(a-1)%N] == new_solution[c] or
            new_solution[a] == new_solution[(b-1)%N] or new_solution[a] == new_solution[(c-1)%N] or
            new_solution[b] == new_solution[(c-1)%N] or new_solution[b] == new_solution[a]):
            return new_solution

        # Perform 3-opt
        segment1 = new_solution[a:b+1]
        segment2 = new_solution[b+1:c+1]
        new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:a], segment2, segment1, new_solution[c+1:]])
    else:
        # Segment reversal
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:a], segment[::-1], new_solution[b+1:]])

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    weights = [0.6, 0.4]  # Weight for first objective is higher
    selected = min(archive, key=lambda x: weights[0]*x[1][0] + weights[1]*x[1][1])[0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search: node insertion + segment rotation
    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to rotate
    a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
    segment_size = b - a + 1

    # Rotate segment left or right
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], 1)
    else:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], -1)

    # Apply node insertion if beneficial
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:  # 40% chance to insert
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]

        # Find best insertion position
        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = cost1 + cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)

    return new_solution

    weights = np.random.uniform(0.3, 0.7)
    scores = [weights * obj[0] + (1 - weights) * obj[1] for _, obj in archive]
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    selected = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Hybrid local search with adaptive probabilities
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:  # Higher probability for relocation
        # Node relocation
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]

        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = weights * cost1 + (1 - weights) * cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)
    else:
        # Segment reversal
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (0.7 * x[1][0] + 0.3 * x[1][1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment rotation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        k = np.random.randint(1, len(segment))
        rotated_segment = np.concatenate([segment[k:], segment[:k]])
        new_solution[a:b+1] = rotated_segment

    # Node transposition with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if i != j and (i != 0 or j != N-1):
            # Evaluate potential transposition
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            swapped_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if swapped_cost < original_cost:
                temp = new_solution[i]
                new_solution[i] = new_solution[j]
                new_solution[j] = temp

    # Conditional edge reversal
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
            reversed_segment = segment[::-1]
            # Evaluate reversal
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if reversed_cost < original_cost:
                new_solution[i:j+1] = reversed_segment

    return new_solution

            if np.random.rand() < 0.4 and new_pos > 0 and new_pos < N-1:
                new_solution[new_pos-1], new_solution[new_pos] = new_solution[new_pos], new_solution[new_pos-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    max_obj1 = max(x[1][0] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    max_obj2 = max(x[1][1] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (x[1][0]/max_obj1 + x[1][1]/max_obj2))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment reversal with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        reversed_segment = segment[::-1]

        # Evaluate reversal based on both objectives
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])
        reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])

        if reversed_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = reversed_segment

    # Objective-aware node swapping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        if i != j:
            # Calculate cost difference for both objectives
            cost_diff = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if cost_diff < 0:
                new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    # Conditional path inversion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        k = np.random.randint(2, N//2)
        path = new_solution[:k]
        inverted_path = path[::-1]

        # Evaluate inversion
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[path[-1], new_solution[k]])
        inverted_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]])

        if inverted_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[:k] = inverted_path

    return new_solution

    objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    diversity_scores = np.std(objectives, axis=0)
    weights = diversity_scores / (np.sum(diversity_scores) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = objectives[:, 0] * weights[0] + objectives[:, 1] * weights[1]
    base_solution = archive[np.argmin(combined_scores)][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Segment rotation with adaptive probability
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        k = np.random.randint(1, N//2)
        new_solution = np.roll(new_solution, k)

    # Node exchange with edge flipping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            new_solution[i:j] = new_solution[i:j][::-1]
        if np.random.rand() < 0.4 and i > 0 and j < N-1:
            new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    obj1 = np.array([obj[0] for _, obj in archive])
    obj2 = np.array([obj[1] for _, obj in archive])
    min1, max1 = np.min(obj1), np.max(obj1)
    min2, max2 = np.min(obj2), np.max(obj2)
    if max1 != min1:
        norm_obj1 = (obj1 - min1) / (max1 - min1)
    else:
        norm_obj1 = np.ones_like(obj1)
    if max2 != min2:
        norm_obj2 = (obj2 - min2) / (max2 - min2)
    else:
        norm_obj2 = np.ones_like(obj2)

    # Adaptive weights based on objective ranges
    range1 = max1 - min1
    range2 = max2 - min2
    total_range = range1 + range2
    if total_range > 0:
        weight1 = range1 / total_range
        weight2 = range2 / total_range
    else:
        weight1 = 0.5
        weight2 = 0.5

    scores = weight1 * norm_obj1 + weight2 * norm_obj2
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    selected = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Dynamic local search operator selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4 + 0.3 * weight1:  # Higher probability for 3-opt when first objective is more important
        # 3-opt
        a, b, c = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=3, replace=False))
        if a == b or b == c or a == c:
            return new_solution

        # Check if 3-opt creates valid tour
        if (new_solution[(a-1)%N] == new_solution[b] or new_solution[(a-1)%N] == new_solution[c] or
            new_solution[a] == new_solution[(b-1)%N] or new_solution[a] == new_solution[(c-1)%N] or
            new_solution[b] == new_solution[(c-1)%N] or new_solution[b] == new_solution[a]):
            return new_solution

        # Perform 3-opt
        segment1 = new_solution[a:b+1]
        segment2 = new_solution[b+1:c+1]
        new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:a], segment2, segment1, new_solution[c+1:]])
    else:
        # Segment reversal
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:a], segment[::-1], new_solution[b+1:]])

    return new_solution

algorithm: {The new algorithm selects a solution from the archive based on a dynamic objective score combining normalized costs and diversity, then applies a hybrid local search combining adaptive segment rotation, objective-aware node insertion, and conditional edge reversal with probabilistic selection criteria.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """
    Select a promising solution from the archive and generate a neighbor solution from it.

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.
             Each objective is a tuple of two float values (cost in each space).
    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).
    """
    if len(archive) > 1:
        objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
        normalized = (objectives - np.min(objectives, axis=0)) / (np.max(objectives, axis=0) - np.min(objectives, axis=0) + 1e-10)
        scores = 0.6 * normalized[:, 0] + 0.4 * normalized[:, 1] - 0.2 * np.linspace(0, 1, len(archive))
        selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    else:
        selected_idx = 0

    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment rotation with objective-aware probability
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5 * (1 - selected_idx/len(archive)):
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        k = np.random.randint(1, len(segment))
        rotated_segment = np.concatenate([segment[k:], segment[:k]])
        new_solution[a:b+1] = rotated_segment

    # Objective-aware node insertion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        if i != j:
            node = new_solution[j]
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, j)
            insert_pos = np.random.choice(N-1)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, insert_pos, node)

    # Conditional edge reversal with cost evaluation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
            reversed_segment = segment[::-1]
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if reversed_cost < original_cost * 1.1:  # Allow slight degradation
                new_solution[i:j+1] = reversed_segment

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    weights = np.random.uniform(0.3, 0.7)
    scores = [weights * obj[0] + (1 - weights) * obj[1] for _, obj in archive]
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    selected = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Hybrid local search with adaptive probabilities
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:  # Higher probability for relocation
        # Node relocation
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]

        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = weights * cost1 + (1 - weights) * cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)
    else:
        # Segment reversal
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (0.7 * x[1][0] + 0.3 * x[1][1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment rotation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        k = np.random.randint(1, len(segment))
        rotated_segment = np.concatenate([segment[k:], segment[:k]])
        new_solution[a:b+1] = rotated_segment

    # Node transposition with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if i != j and (i != 0 or j != N-1):
            # Evaluate potential transposition
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            swapped_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if swapped_cost < original_cost:
                temp = new_solution[i]
                new_solution[i] = new_solution[j]
                new_solution[j] = temp

    # Conditional edge reversal
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
            reversed_segment = segment[::-1]
            # Evaluate reversal
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if reversed_cost < original_cost:
                new_solution[i:j+1] = reversed_segment

    return new_solution

    selected = min(archive, key=lambda x: weights[0]*x[1][0] + weights[1]*x[1][1])[0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search: node insertion + segment rotation
    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to rotate
    a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
    segment_size = b - a + 1

    # Rotate segment left or right
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], 1)
    else:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], -1)

    # Apply node insertion if beneficial
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:  # 40% chance to insert
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]

        # Find best insertion position
        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = cost1 + cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)

    return new_solution

    objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    norm_objectives = (objectives - objectives.min(axis=0)) / (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = norm_objectives[:, 0] * 0.6 + norm_objectives[:, 1] * 0.4
    base_solution = archive[np.argmin(combined_scores)][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Segment reversal with probabilistic check
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if b - a > 1:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    # Node relocation with edge inversion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        node = np.random.choice(new_solution)
        old_pos = np.where(new_solution == node)[0][0]
        new_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        if new_pos != old_pos:
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:old_pos], new_solution[old_pos+1:]])
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:new_pos], [node], new_solution[new_pos:]])
            if np.random.rand() < 0.3 and new_pos > 0 and new_pos < N-1:
                new_solution[new_pos-1], new_solution[new_pos] = new_solution[new_pos], new_solution[new_pos-1]

    return new_solution

function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """
    Select a promising solution from the archive and generate a neighbor solution from it.

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.
             Each objective is a tuple of two float values (cost in each space).
    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).
    """
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (x[1][0] + x[1][1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment reversal
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        segment_length = np.random.randint(2, min(6, N//2))
        start = np.random.randint(0, N - segment_length + 1)
        new_solution[start:start+segment_length] = new_solution[start:start+segment_length][::-1]

    # Objective-weighted node relocation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.7:
        i = np.random.randint(0, N)
        node = new_solution[i]
        candidate_positions = list(range(N))
        candidate_positions.remove(i)

        best_pos = i
        best_cost = float('inf')

        for pos in candidate_positions:
            candidate = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], new_solution[i+1:]])
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, pos, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = cost1 + cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = pos

        if best_pos != i:
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], new_solution[i+1:]])
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)

    # Probabilistic multi-segment shuffling
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        num_segments = np.random.randint(2, 4)
        segment_indices = sorted(np.random.choice(range(1, N), size=num_segments-1, replace=False))
        segments = np.split(new_solution, segment_indices)
        np.random.shuffle(segments)
        new_solution = np.concatenate(segments)

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (0.7 * x[1][0] + 0.3 * x[1][1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment rotation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        k = np.random.randint(1, len(segment))
        rotated_segment = np.concatenate([segment[k:], segment[:k]])
        new_solution[a:b+1] = rotated_segment

    # Node transposition with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if i != j and (i != 0 or j != N-1):
            # Evaluate potential transposition
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            swapped_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if swapped_cost < original_cost:
                temp = new_solution[i]
                new_solution[i] = new_solution[j]
                new_solution[j] = temp

    # Conditional edge reversal
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
            reversed_segment = segment[::-1]
            # Evaluate reversal
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if reversed_cost < original_cost:
                new_solution[i:j+1] = reversed_segment

    return new_solution
